parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: External information systems are catalogued

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The organizationâ€™s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The organization's place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Risk responses are identified and prioritized

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The organization's determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization's cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers

groups.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Category

controls.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Subcategory 1

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes

controls.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Subcategory 2

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Physical access to assets is managed and protected

controls.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Subcategory 3

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Remote access is managed

controls.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Subcategory 4

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties

controls.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Subcategory 5

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation)

controls.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Subcategory 6

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions

controls.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control Subcategory 7

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individualsâ€™ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: All users are informed and trained

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Data-at-rest is protected

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Data-in-transit is protected

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Protections against data leaks are implemented

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity

groups.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Category

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 1

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality)

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 2

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 3

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configuration change control processes are in place

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 4

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 5

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 6

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Data is destroyed according to policy

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 7

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Protection processes are improved

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 8

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 9

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 10

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Response and recovery plans are tested

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 11

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening)

controls.title: Information Protection Processes and Procedures Subcategory 12

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Communications and control networks are protected

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Impact of events is determined

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incident alert thresholds are established

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Malicious code is detected

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Unauthorized mobile code is detected

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Vulnerability scans are performed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Detection processes are tested

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Event detection information is communicated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Detection processes are continuously improved

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Response plan is executed during or after an incident

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information is shared consistent with response plans

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Notifications from detection systems are investigated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The impact of the incident is understood

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Forensics are performed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g. internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incidents are contained

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incidents are mitigated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Response plans incorporate lessons learned

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Response strategies are updated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Recovery strategies are updated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Public relations are managed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Reputation is repaired after an incident

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Reputation is repaired after an incident
